title: Mikheil Kavelashvili - Wikipedia
snippet: Mikheil Kavelashvili (Georgian: მიხეილ ყაველაშვილი [miχeil qʼaveɫaʃʷili]; born 22 July 1971) is a Georgian politician and former professional footballer who was sworn in as the sixth president of Georgia on 29 December 2024.

title: Who is Mikheil Kavelashvili, Georgia's new president? | Euronews
snippet: 53-year-old former Manchester City football player Mikheil Kavelashvili has become Georgia's new president.

title: Georgia: Ex-footballer Mikheil Kavelashvili named president
snippet: A former Manchester City footballer has been appointed president by Georgia's disputed parliament, after 17 days of pro-EU protests that have swept this country's towns and cities.

title: Georgian ruling party candidate Kavelashvili becomes president with country’s EU bid in limbo | PBS News
snippet: Former soccer player Mikheil Kavelashvili became president of Georgia on Saturday, as the ruling party tightened its grip in what the opposition calls a blow to the country’s EU aspirations and a victory for former imperial ruler Russia.

title: Former Manchester City footballer Mikheil Kavelashvili elected new President of Georgia | LBC
snippet: Mikheil Kavelashvili has been elected the new President of Georgia.
